acctName.description: Sets the account name that displays on all reports.
acctName.name: acctName

acctNumber.description: Required when the Use Account Numbers preference is enabled.
acctNumber.name: acctNumber

acctType.value.description: Sets the type of account. Can only be set on Add. Some account types listed here are unavailable in the NetSuite UI. For more details, see the topic called Chart of Accounts Import in the Help Center. Account type codes are:0 - Bank1 - Accts Receivable2 - Inventory 4 - Other Curr Assets5 - Fixed Assets6 - Accum Deprec.8 - Other Assets10 - Accts Payable12 - Oth Curr Liab.14 - Long Term Liab.16 - Equity-No Close18 - Retained Earn�s19 - Equity-Closes21 - Income23 - COGS24 - Expense25 - Other Income26 - Other Expense
acctType.value.name: acctType.value

billableExpensesAcct.externalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
billableExpensesAcct.externalId.displayName: Track Billable Expenses in - External id
billableExpensesAcct.externalId.name: billableExpensesAcct.externalId

billableExpensesAcct.internalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
billableExpensesAcct.internalId.displayName: Track Billable Expenses in - Internal id
billableExpensesAcct.internalId.name: billableExpensesAcct.internalId

billableExpensesAcct.name.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
billableExpensesAcct.name.name: billableExpensesAcct.name

cashFlowRate.value.description: Select the type of exchange rate that is used to translate foreign currency amounts for this account in the cash flow statement.The Current rate type is based on the currency exchange rate that is effective at the end of the reported upon period.The Average rate type is calculated from a weighted average of the exchange rates for transactions applied during the period to accounts with a general rate type of Average. This rate is the default.The Historical rate type is calculated from a weighted average of the exchange rates for transactions applied during the period to accounts with a general rate type of Historical.
cashFlowRate.value.name: cashFlowRate.value

curDocNum.description: Defaults to the next check number in the sequence but can be overwritten.
curDocNum.name: curDocNum

currency.externalId.description: Sets the currency for the funds in this account. Can only be set on Add. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: Sets the currency for the funds in this account. Can only be set on Add. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: Sets the currency for the funds in this account. Can only be set on Add. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
currency.name.name: currency.name

department.externalId.description: Sets the department to restrict use of this account to roles with permission to access it. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

description.description: Enter a description for this account.
description.name: description

eliminate.description: Check this box to make this account an intercompany account. Intercompany accounts are used to record transactions between subsidiaries.You can post both intercompany transactions and non-intercompany transactions to most intercompany accounts. Intercompany Accounts Receivable and Intercompany Accounts Payable, however, can be used only for recording amounts that are candidates for eliminations.For details, see the help topic Intercompany Accounts.
eliminate.name: eliminate

exchangeRate.description: This is a read-only field based on the value selected for currency.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

includeChildren.description: Check the Include Children box to share the account with all the sub-subsidiaries associated with each subsidiary selected in the Subsidiary field.
includeChildren.name: includeChildren

inventory.description: If TRUE, the account balance is included in the Inventory KPI. It cannot be modified on certain system-generated OCAsset accounts.
inventory.name: inventory

legalName.description: If the Use Legal Name in Account accounting preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Preferences > Accounting Preferences, the Legal Name field appears. You can enter up to 400 characters in this field including special characters such as colon and semi colon. You can also enter characters such as Éé,Çç, and 2 byte characters such as 会計、科目.This field is useful in countries where the legal name of an entity is required by law.The Legal Name field can be added to financial reports where account is an available component. It is also available in advanced searches, SuiteScript, and ODBC. System notes maintains an audit trail specific to the activity on the Legal Name field.
legalName.name: legalName

location.externalId.description: Sets the location to restrict use of this account to roles with permission to access it. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.

openingBalance.description: Sets the opening balance for this account.

revalue.description: Check this box to select this account for open balance currency revaluation.
revalue.displayName: Revalue Open Balance for Foreign Currency Transactions
revalue.name: revalue

unit.externalId.description: This field can be used only when the acctype field for the record is _statistical. The unit field displays the base unit assigned to the unitsType. This field cannot be changed after the record is created.
unit.externalId.name: unit.externalId
